_header: With a garland of thorns keen
Note: For other MSS see 6744; Cf. also 1565.
_description: The Wounds of Christ as Remedies against the Deadly Sins — eight quatrains

CULFf548.First Lines:
With a garlande of thornes keneMy hed was crowned & þat
                    was sene…
CULFf548.Last Lines:
…ffor sake þi synne and luf meAmende þe and I forgif
                    þe
CULFf548.Note:
Headed ‘Mercy’ and with rubric names of seven deadly sins
                    written in margins beside the stanzas.
CULFf548.Editions:
Person,  Henry Axel. 
             Cambridge Middle English Lyrics.
         Seattle: University of Washington Press, 1953; rev. ed. 1962: 10-11.
Davies,  Reginald Thorne. 
             Medieval English Lyrics: a critical anthology.
         London, 1963; Evanston, IL: Northwestern UP, 1964: 207-8.
Stevick,  Robert D.,
                        ed.  
             One Hundred Middle English Lyrics.
         Indianapolis: Bobbs-Merrill, 1964: 79-80.
Downing,  Janay Young A.,
                        ed.  
             “A Critical Edition of Cambridge University MS Ff.5.48.” 
         2 vols. Diss. University of Washington, 1969: 101-2.

CamJes13.First Lines:
wyth the garlond of thornes kenemyn heed was bowonden that was wyl
                    senethe streem of blod an be my chekethou proud man therfore me
                    meke…
CamJes13.Last Lines:
…In al my thyrst vpon the rodethe Iewys me goue to thynggis
                    vngoodeesyl & galle for thyrst to drynkeglotun therof I rede the
                    thynke
CamJes13.Editions:
Hanna,  Ralph,
                        ed.  
             “Verses in Sermons Again: The Case of Cambridge, Jesus College, MS
                Q.A.13.” 
             Studies in Bibliography
         57(2005-6): 63-83: 77-8.
